poem:
Title: "Who Plays The Ref"

Down the fog-lit corridors of power,
A puppet-dance ensues.
The wolfen ploys of Farage,
A BBC cornered in the guise of news. 

"Let them prance," the brass bell tolls,
In election's bloodied mire,
A referee in a game of cheats,
Sacrificial on the pyre.

"If they thirst for a quarrel," he boasts,
The echoes carry his feud,
Tarnishing the glass-eyed ether,
With a shadow, cold and crude.
